intro: Ternstroemia gedehensis, commonly known as the Ethiopian holly, is a small evergreen shrub native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Ternstroemia gedehensis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant in some regions.
